text: Denise Jeanne Horine (born Denise Jeanne Briault; May 3, 1929 - September 27, 2015), better known by her stage name Denise Lor, was an American actress and singer. She was born in Los Angeles. She moved to Long Island at age five. She was best known for being on the CBS series The Garry Moore Show for eight years in the 1950s and 1960s. She was also known for her song, "If I Give My Heart to You", which charted at #8 in September 1954. She appeared in over 100 stage productions, including Gypsy, Annie and Sweeney Todd. Lor was married twice. She had two sons from her first, Ron and Denis Martin. She died in September 2015 at the age of 86. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1929 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:Comedians from Los Angeles Category:American movie actors Category:American pop singers Category:American radio actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Comedians from New York (state) Category:Singers from Los Angeles Category:Singers from New York (state)
title: Denise Lor
